body_html:
I have the same issue.
It seems as if pytorch is looping the whole memory (takes up to 3 minutes on my machine E5-2620).
I attached the strace of:
strace python -c "import torch; torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1)" 2>&1 | tee strace.log
Anyway, the issue seems to be fixed with 0.3.0.post4, but might be helpful in case of a regression.

Affected Version:
Python: (3, 6, 4)
CuDNN: 7005
CUDA: 8.0.61
Torch: 0.3.0
Numpy: 1.14.0

Working Version:
Python: (3, 6, 3) <-- No effect
CuDNN: 7003 <-- No effect
CUDA: 9.0.176 <-- No effect
Torch: 0.3.0.post4 <-- This fixes the issue
Numpy: 1.13.3

Important:
The version from the official conda stream (pkgs/main) is affected at the moment. Take the one from pytorch directly, which is working:
conda install -c pytorch pytorch

strace.zip

body:
I have the same issue. 
It seems as if pytorch is looping the whole memory (takes up to 3 minutes on my machine E5-2620). 
I attached the strace of:
`strace python -c "import torch; torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1)" 2>&1 | tee strace.log`
Anyway, the issue seems to be fixed with 0.3.0.post4, but might be helpful in case of a regression.

Affected Version:
Python: (3, 6, 4)
CuDNN: 7005
CUDA: 8.0.61
Torch: 0.3.0
Numpy: 1.14.0

Working Version:
Python: (3, 6, 3)    <-- No effect
CuDNN: 7003       <-- No effect
CUDA: 9.0.176      <-- No effect
Torch: 0.3.0.post4 <-- This fixes the issue
Numpy: 1.13.3

Important:
The version from the official conda stream (pkgs/main) is affected at the moment. Take the one from pytorch directly, which is working:
`conda install -c pytorch pytorch`

[strace.zip](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1745793/strace.zip)
